newsitem.title: SPAIN: Repsol shares gain on LPG price freeze removal.
newsitem.headline: Repsol shares gain on LPG price freeze removal.

text.p: Shares in Spain's Repsol outpaced the indices on Monday after the Industry Ministry confirmed it would cancel a price freeze imposed on liquid petroleum gas (LPG), a factor which has weighed on the energy firm's results.
At 0930 GMT Repsol was up 80 pesetas, 1.12 percent, to 6,330 while the Ibex-35 blue chip index gained 0.48 percent to 6,972.42.

"This is very important news which could add around 10 percent to Repsol's annual operating profit. We'll be revising up our year-end profits forecasts," said a dealer at a Spanish bank who requested anonymity.
He set a medium-term target price for the shares of 6,700 pesetas.
Repsol's operating profit in 1996 was 198.6 billion pesetas.

"In the first quarter, the effect of LPG on the operating results from the gas division was 12 billion pesetas, although the effect in that quarter, because of seasonal factors, is much greater than in the rest of the year. But the overall impact on its profit and loss account is substantial," he added.
